lead_paragraph: If Joseph Stalin had established a better reputation for truth telling and straight dealing before Hitler invaded Russia, it would be possible to take considerably more satisfaction in his radio speech of yesterday than one can take now. We cannot interpret a speech by Mr. Stalin as we would a speech by Mr. Churchill.
